basis: User explicitly commits to a micro-step today and indicates willingness to involve a trusted person if it feels right, signaling a high likelihood they will perform the suggested action.
cognitive_dissonance: Ongoing tension between the desire to move forward and anxiety about eating goals; the ultra-low-pressure framing helps reduce this conflict and enables small progress.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about eating goals; fear of losing control; self-criticism when anxious or fatigued.
emotional_triggers: Anxiety around eating, fatigue, perceived pressure from goals or others, and uncertainty about how to proceed.
coaching_notes: Continue with ultra-low-pressure micro-steps and optional social support. Reinforce the idea that rest is acceptable and progress can be nonlinear. Offer simple, concrete options and check-ins to sustain engagement without overwhelming the user.
